    • Method Detail

      • showQuestion

        public static final java.lang.Object showQuestion(java.lang.String message,
                            java.lang.String title)
                                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Shows a message box and returns an object introduced.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to show before the input field.
        title - the title. If null, WebApp.getAppName() is used.
        Returns:
        the object. NULL means that CANCEL, otherwise means an Object is being passed. Note: if the event processing thread is disable, it always returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • showInput

        public static final int showInput(java.lang.String message,
            java.lang.String title,
            int buttons,
            java.lang.String icon,
            int focus,
            org.zkoss.zk.ui.event.EventListener listener)
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Shows a message box and returns what button is pressed.
        Parameters:
        title - the title. If null, WebApp.getAppName() is used.
        buttons - a combination of Messagebox.OK, Messagebox.CANCEL, Messagebox.YES, Messagebox.NO, Messagebox.ABORT, Messagebox.RETRY, and Messagebox.IGNORE. If zero, Messagebox.OK is assumed
        icon - one of predefined images: Messagebox.QUESTION, Messagebox.EXCLAMATION, Messagebox.ERROR, Messagebox.NONE, or any style class name(s) to show an image.
        focus - one of button to have to focus. If 0, the first button will gain the focus. One of Messagebox.OK, Messagebox.CANCEL, Messagebox.YES, Messagebox.NO, Messagebox.ABORT, Messagebox.RETRY, and Messagebox.IGNORE.
        listener - the event listener which is invoked when a button is clicked. Ignored if null. It is useful if the event processing thread is disabled (Configuration.enableEventThread(boolean)). If the event processing thread is disable, this method always return Messagebox.OK. To know which button is pressed, you have to pass an event listener. Then, when the user clicks a button, the event listener is invoked. You can identify which button is clicked by examining the event name (Event.getName()) as shown in the following table. Alternatively, you can examine the value of Event.getData(), which must be an integer represetinng the button, such as Messagebox.OK, Messagebox.YES and so on.
        ButtonEvent Name
        OKonOK
        CancelonCancel
        YesonYes
        NoonNo
        RetryonRetry
        AbortonAbort
        IgnoreonIgnore
        Returns:
        the button being pressed (one of Messagebox.OK, Messagebox.CANCEL, Messagebox.YES, Messagebox.NO, Messagebox.ABORT, Messagebox.RETRY, and Messagebox.IGNORE). Note: if the event processing thread is disable, it always returns Messagebox.OK.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Since:
        3.0.4
